scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, 1964-1966, between Henry Miller, Pacific Palisades, Calif., and William H. Runge, Charlottesville, Va., concerns Miller's gift to the University of Virginia Library of six watercolors and a copy of "Into the Night Life."

did.unittitle: Henry Miller, Pacific Palisades, California, to William H. Runge, University of Virginia Library 1965 Oct 18

scopecontent.p: Offering a donation of a few of his water colors

did.unittitle: Henry Miller, Pacific Palisades, California, to William H. Runge, University of Virginia Library 1965 Dec 9

scopecontent.p: Informing him of the impeding arrival of the six water colors and requesting his acknowledgement of receipt and their value of $1500

did.unittitle: Henry Miller, Pacific Palisades, California, to William H. Runge, University of Virginia Library 1965 Dec 28

scopecontent.p: Requesting the acknowledgement of valuation prior to the last day of the year, and asking for the return of any water colors not suitable

did.unittitle: Henry Miller's assistant, Marcia Pessis, to William H. Runge 1964 Sep 4

scopecontent.p: Informing him that a copy of "Into the Night Life" and a few water colors will be arriving shortly, and explaining that because of Miller's friendship with Lawrence Clark Powell he gives his literary material to the U.C.L.A. Library

did.unittitle: Henry Miller's assistant, Connie Shepard, to William H. Runge 1965 Dec 1

scopecontent.p: Sending word of the water colors being sent and that Miller needs acknowledgement and evaluation of them as soon as possible

did.unittitle: Henry Miller's assistant, Connie Shepard, to William H. Runge 1966 Apr 9

scopecontent.p: Requesting for Miller color slides or transparencies of the water colors previously sent to the Library, and explaining the best way to take photographs of the water colors

did.unittitle: William H. Runge to Henry Miller's assistant, Marcia Pessis 1964 Sep 9

scopecontent.p: Acknowledging her letter of September 4th, and commenting on Miller's archive going to the U.C.L.A. Library

did.unittitle: William H. Runge to Henry Miller 1964 Sep 25

scopecontent.p: Acknowledging receipt of "Into the Night Life" and commenting on its being beautifully done and looking forward to the arrival of the water colors

did.unittitle: William H. Runge to Henry Miller 1965 Nov 8

scopecontent.p: Writing that the Library would be delighted to accept the water colors

did.unittitle: William H. Runge to Henry Miller 1965 Dec 30

scopecontent.p: Acknowledging receipt of the water colors and their value of $1500 as reported to the University's Rector and Visitors
